Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a wide variety of plants and animals, including humans, accurately in their natural habitats.
The student can label various parts of the habitat and identify where each plant or animal lives.
The student can clearly illustrate the needs of each plant or animal, such as water for fish and sunlight for plants.
The student can show relationships between organisms and their needs, depicting things like birds needing trees for nests.
The student can demonstrate how habitats provide necessary resources, detailing how forests provide food and shelter.
The student can identify and align specific environments to the optimal needs of the living things depicted.
The student can illustrate how plants, animals, and their environments create systems that interconnect to support life.
CANNOT: The student may sometimes omit minor details or labels that don't critically impact understanding.
The student might occasionally misplace a label, but it does not detract from the overall comprehension of the relationships.
